qas.question: Who oversees the transit network in Paris?
What was the STIF formerly known as?
How many bus lines does the STIF oversee?
How many bus lines does the Optile Consortium manage?

context: Paris is a major rail, highway, and air transport hub. <a0_0>The Syndicat des transports d'Île-de-France<a0_0/> (STIF), formerly <a1_0>Syndicat des transports parisiens<a1_0/> (STP), oversees the transit network in the region. The syndicate coordinates public transport and contracts it out to the RATP (operating <a2_0>347<a2_0/> bus lines, the Métro, eight tramway lines, and sections of the RER), the SNCF (operating suburban rails, one tramway line and the other sections of the RER) and the Optile consortium of private operators managing <a3_0>1,176<a3_0/> bus lines.
